page.title: 13Archie Belaney of Hastings.
page.content: I live near{St. Helens Woods and sometimes I play there. At school we read about a boy called{Archie {Belaney}who was always playing Red Indians in{St. Helens Woods.}When he grew up he went to{Canada and lived {with the Indians.}He married an Indian girl and he went trapping beavers for their fur. After a few years he felt sorry for the beavers and rescued two baby ones. He wrote books about beavers and became very famous. Everybody thought he was a chief called{Grey Owl.}He even had tea with the{King}in{Buckingham Palace!}Some of his things are in our{Museum.}He was filmed and photographed. He made people want to preserve wildlife. You can still read{Archie Belaney's}books because they are in the Library.
